name: Avoid tables having indexes with a too large index definition (PeopleSoft)
description:
This rule will report a violation where the number of columns on an index exceeds a parameter, named "PeopleSoft: Max column per index".
The default value is 3. (This parameter is configurable).
output:
Associated to each Index with violations, the quality rule provides: 
- The index name.
- The associated value is the number of columns of the composite index.
rationale: Every column in the index increases the time it takes to perform INSERTS, UPDATES and DELETES, so the number of columns in the index should not be too high. Try to not use more than a maximum of 3 columns in the index. If you have a read-only table, then the number of columns in index is not as important and thus may be larger.
reference:
Standard best practice on indexes
CISQ rule : ASCPEM-PRF-6
CWE-1089: Large Data Table with Excessive Number of Indices
https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/1089.html
remediation:
After study, remove unnecessary columns from the index.
Promote usage of index having less columns.
